Major_Arcs.title: Ghost Town and Temporal Anomalies
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the setting of Ghost Town and the initial mystery surrounding its seemingly anachronistic nature, focusing on the woman in the green hat's experiences and reactions.

sub_scenes.title: Saloon and Time Realization
sub_scenes.description: Introduction to the saloon setting in Ghost Town and the woman's initial realization about the temporal anomaly.

narrative_arcs.title: Woman's Internal Thoughts on Time Discrepancy

sub_scenes.title: Conversation about Leaving Ghost Town
sub_scenes.description: Introduction of new characters and a dialogue about the dangers and repeated misfortunes associated with Ghost Town, creating initial conflict and urgency.

Major_Arcs.title: Ghost Town's Past, Present, and Imminent Demise
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts focus to Nan's memories of Ghost Town, the clarification of its current state as Merrick Gulch, and the introduction of the airport construction plan, setting up a conflict between preservation and progress.

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Memory of Ghost Town
sub_scenes.description: Nan reflects on her nostalgic memories of Ghost Town, contrasting its romantic past with the harsh reality.

sub_scenes.title: Clarification and Airport Plans
sub_scenes.description: The current status of Ghost Town as Merrick Gulch is clarified, and the imminent airport construction plans are revealed by surveyors.

narrative_arcs.title: Clarification of Ghost Town's Current State

sub_scenes.title: Reactions to Demolition Plans
sub_scenes.description: Nan overhears the airport plans and reacts with shock and disbelief, leading to a confrontation with the surveyors who justify the demolition.

narrative_arcs.title: Reaction to Airport Plan - Initial Shock and Disbelief

Major_Arcs.title: Relationship Dynamics and the Demolition of a Dream
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc explores the complex relationship between Nan and Cal, contrasting Nan's romantic ideals with Cal's practicality, set against the backdrop of Ghost Town's demolition, highlighting Nan's emotional distress and sense of loss.

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Notions vs. Practical Love
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal discuss their relationship dynamics, focusing on Nan's romantic ideals and Cal's more practical expressions of love, revealing past conflicts and misunderstandings.

narrative_arcs.title: Cal's Perspective on Dreams and Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Demolition and Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: The scene shifts to the active demolition of Ghost Town, depicting a chaotic and confrontational atmosphere, emphasizing the destruction of Nan's 'dream'.

Major_Arcs.title: Family, Business, and Emotional Turmoil
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Nan's family dynamics, her conflict with her father regarding business and her opinions being dismissed, leading to emotional distress and a sense of betrayal.

sub_scenes.title: Business Logistics and Airport Horses
sub_scenes.description: Business discussions about shipping and airport logistics transition into arrangements for horses needed for construction, involving Nan and her father in the conversation.

sub_scenes.title: Paternal Dismissal and Threat
sub_scenes.description: Nan confronts her father about feeling dismissed, leading to a stern and threatening response from him, highlighting their power dynamic and Nan's suppression.

sub_scenes.title: Humiliation and Betrayal
sub_scenes.description: Nan experiences deep humiliation and betrayal after the confrontation with her father, feeling unsupported by Cal, and seeking solace but finding limited comfort.

Major_Arcs.title: Reassurance, Resolve, and Business Urgency
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc deals with attempts to reassure Nan about Cal's love, Nan's internal resolve to seek clarity, and a sudden shift back to business urgency regarding the horses and the airport.

sub_scenes.title: Maternal Comfort and Relationship Advice
sub_scenes.description: Nan's mother comforts her, offering relationship advice and reassuring her about Cal's love and intentions.

narrative_arcs.title: Confirmation of Cal's Affection and Effort

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Resolve for Clarity
sub_scenes.description: Despite reassurances, Nan feels uncertain and resolves to seek clarity about her relationship with Cal, determined to confront him.

sub_scenes.title: Business Urgency and Deal
sub_scenes.description: A sudden shift back to business urgency with news about horses arriving for the airport, followed by Nan confronting a man about a business deal, revealing her assertive nature.

Major_Arcs.title: Confrontation, Departure, and Lingering Longing
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Nan's emotional confrontation with Cal, his cryptic responses and departure, Nan's frustration, and the passage of time filled with longing for him.

sub_scenes.title: Expression of Deep Feelings and Departure
sub_scenes.description: Nan expresses her deepest feelings to Cal, questioning his emotions, while Cal's response is cryptic and leads to his abrupt departure.

narrative_arcs.title: Expression of Deep Feelings and Cryptic Response
Passage of Time and Lingering Longing
Confession of Pursuit and Revealed Motivation

Major_Arcs.title: Blizzard and Crisis: Personal and Ranch-Wide
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the severe blizzard and its impact, shifting from personal relationship drama to a broader crisis affecting the ranch and livestock, leading to collective worry and eventual relief.

sub_scenes.title: Confession and Weather Report
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal continue their intimate conversation, interrupted by Mr. Wills' arrival with a grim weather report, shifting the focus from personal to environmental crisis.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Confession about Changed Behavior

sub_scenes.title: Livestock Fodder Crisis
sub_scenes.description: Focus shifts to the dire situation of dwindling livestock fodder due to the heavy snow, highlighting the practical and economic impact of the blizzard.

narrative_arcs.title: Indoor Discussion of Weather and Worry for Loved Ones
Cal's Determined Resolve and Acceptance of Responsibility

Major_Arcs.title: Operation Hay Lift and Renewed Hope
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the resolution of the blizzard crisis through 'Operation Hay Lift', bringing relief and renewed hope, contrasting with the earlier despair and highlighting the community's response.

sub_scenes.title: Indoor Concerns and Outdoor Relief
sub_scenes.description: Contrasting scenes of indoor worry and initial outdoor reassurance, leading to Nan's expression of hopelessness and Cal's distress.

narrative_arcs.title: Recollection of Restlessness and Expression of Hopelessness
Arrival of the Plane and Fodder Drop
Relief, Gratitude, and Renewed Hope with 'Operation Hay Lift'

Major_Arcs.title: Western Town Showdown and Varying Perspectives
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to a new setting in a Western town, focusing on a cowboy showdown and the diverse reactions and opinions of the townspeople regarding the cowboy's actions and character.

sub_scenes.title: Cowboy Showdown and Town Reaction
sub_scenes.description: Introduction to a Western town scene with a cowboy triumphing in a showdown, and the immediate varied reactions from onlookers.

narrative_arcs.title: Defense and Critique of Cowboy's Manners

Major_Arcs.title: Jeff's Hero Worship and Gun Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc centers on Sally's concern about her brother Jeff's hero worship of Clyde Surrett and his growing obsession with guns, highlighting sibling conflict and differing perspectives on masculinity.

sub_scenes.title: Sally's Concern for Jeff
sub_scenes.description: Sally expresses her worry about Jeff's hero worship and unhealthy fascination with violence, discussing it with Pete and leading to a confrontation with Jeff.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Concern for Jeff's Hero Worship
Sally's Disappointment and Jeff's Clyde Surrett Defense
Jeff's Justification of Clyde Surrett and Dismissal of Chane Benson
Sally's Rejection of Jeff's Claims and Warning
Jeff's Threat and Sally's Fearful Response

Major_Arcs.title: Intervention and Escalating Town Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Sally and Pete's intervention to help Jeff, leading to Sally's plea to Clyde, and the escalating conflict in town related to Clyde's article and Benson's reaction.

sub_scenes.title: Sally's Plea to Clyde and Pete's Commitment
sub_scenes.description: Sally expresses her deep concern about Jeff's behavior to Clyde, and Pete commits to helping Jeff, highlighting their shared worry and intentions.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Plea to Clyde and His Reassurance
Pete's Commitment to Helping Jeff and Sally's Appreciation
Pete's Flashback and Gun Advice to Young Jeff
Introduction of Mr. Benson and His Humble Response

sub_scenes.title: Town's Outrage and Sally's Warning to Benson
sub_scenes.description: Townspeople react angrily to Clyde's article, and Sally warns Mr. Benson about Clyde's anger, setting up a tense confrontation.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Warning to Mr. Benson about Clyde's Anger
Mr. Benson's Dismissal of Danger and Confrontation with Sally
Mr. Benson's Justification for Staying in Town

Major_Arcs.title: Clyde's Defiance and Benson's Confrontation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Clyde's defiant stance regarding his article, despite threats, and the escalating confrontation involving Benson, setting up a showdown.

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Clyde's Defiance
sub_scenes.description: Clyde faces immediate confrontations and threats due to his article, but remains defiant, emphasizing his commitment to journalistic integrity.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Defense Regarding Clyde's Article
Background on Clyde's Defiant Actions and Consequences
Sally and Jeff's Discussion about Clyde and Benson's Conflict
Dinner Invitation and Evaluation of Chane's Skills

Major_Arcs.title: Dinner, Accusations, and Physical Confrontation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the dinner invitation to Chane, escalating tension between Jeff and Sally, leading to accusations, physical struggle, and Benson's violent intervention.

sub_scenes.title: Dinner Agreement and Moonlight Scene
sub_scenes.description: The dinner arrangement is confirmed, and a moonlight scene between Chane and Sally sets a subtle tone of underlying tension and strategy.

sub_scenes.title: Benson's Assault and Aftermath
sub_scenes.description: Chane interrupts Jeff and Sally's confrontation, followed by Benson's sudden and violent assault on Jeff, escalating the conflict to physical violence.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Urgency and Chane's Pursuit of Clyde

Major_Arcs.title: Pursuit, Town Confrontation, and Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Jeff and Sally's pursuit after Chane, leading to a town confrontation involving Benson, and ultimately resolving with Benson leaving town.

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Determined Ride
sub_scenes.description: Jeff, despite being injured, rides determinedly to town in response to Sally's urgent news about Chane pursuing Clyde.

sub_scenes.title: Office Wait and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Jeff and his colleague wait tensely in the office after the confrontation, leading to relief and the preparation of the newspaper edition about Benson leaving town.

narrative_arcs.title: Anticipation and Fear at the Door

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Life, New Boss, and Ranch Troubles
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to a new setting at a ranch, introducing a new boss, Steve Daley, and highlighting ranch conflicts and troubles, creating a new storyline separate from the town conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Brawl and New Hired Man
sub_scenes.description: Introduction to a ranch setting with a physical brawl, followed by the introduction of Steve Daley as the new hired man and potential 'Boss'.

narrative_arcs.title: Ranch Brawl and Rejection of Gunplay
Introducing Steve Daley and the New Boss
Confirmation of Betsy's Competence and Steve's Approval
Steve's Casual Acceptance and Betsy's Amusement
Hank's Skepticism and Betsy's Defense of Steve
Betsy's Accusation and Hank's Explanation of Ranch Troubles
Mutual Caution and Agreement to Investigate
Departure to Town and Buckboard Ride
Questioning Hank's Orders and Material for Dress

Major_Arcs.title: Town Confrontation and Gunslinger Proposition
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Betsy and Steve's arrival in town, a confrontation with Fred Bridges' men, and Steve's proposition to work as a gunslinger for Betsy, leading to romantic developments.

sub_scenes.title: Town Arrival and Bridges' Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Betsy and Steve arrive in town and are immediately confronted by Fred Bridges and his men, leading to a physical fight.

sub_scenes.title: Gunslinger Proposition and Romantic Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Following the fight, Steve proposes to work as a gunslinger, leading to romantic revelations, a proposal, and Betsy and Steve's agreement.

Major_Arcs.title: Valley Route, Ambush Flashback, and Determined Ride
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to a new conflict with Bridges again, a warning about the valley route, a flashback of Steve's betrayal, and his determined ride towards confrontation.

sub_scenes.title: Bridges' Complaint and Valley Route Danger
sub_scenes.description: Old Man Bridges complains to Betsy, leading to Bridges' men threatening trespassers, and Betsy warning Steve about the dangerous valley route.

narrative_arcs.title: Valley Route Warning and Impending Confrontation

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Confrontation and Devil's Pass
sub_scenes.description: Emotional confrontation between Betsy and Steve, Steve's determined departure despite Betsy's pleas, and his ride towards Devil's Pass.

Major_Arcs.title: Devil's Pass Showdown and Romantic Reunion
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the confrontation at Devil's Pass, Betsy's intervention and injury, and the subsequent romantic reunion and resolution between Betsy and Steve.

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Intervention at Devil's Pass
sub_scenes.description: Steve arrives at Devil's Pass for a confrontation, leading to Betsy's intervention and her getting shot during the standoff.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Devil's Pass and Confrontation

Major_Arcs.title: Rancher's Daughter and New Ranch Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to a new storyline focusing on a Rancher's daughter, her concern for Dave, and a new ranch conflict involving Bear Fenin's gang and fencing disputes.

sub_scenes.title: Worry for Dave and Ranch Troubles
sub_scenes.description: Introduction of a Rancher's daughter worried about Dave and a new ranch conflict involving Bear Fenin's gang and encroaching on their land.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern for Dave and Father's Disapproval
Reflection on Morning Routine and Curley's Presence
Concern about Curley and Bear Fenin's Trouble

sub_scenes.title: Fence Dispute and Gun Threat
sub_scenes.description: A fence dispute escalates into a tense confrontation with Fred Gordon and Curley, culminating in Curley drawing a gun and threatening violence.

narrative_arcs.title: Dispute Over Fencing and Grazing Land
Escalating Tension Over Fence and Water Access
Defensive Stance and Threat of Gunplay
Curley's Gun Draw and Impending Violence

Major_Arcs.title: Romantic Entanglements and Business Deals
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc explores complex romantic relationships involving Carrie, Dave, and Fred Gordon, intertwined with business matters and a shift towards romantic climax and rejection.

sub_scenes.title: Curley's Apology and Carrie's Confession
sub_scenes.description: Curley apologizes to Carrie, followed by Carrie and Dave discussing their feelings, and Carrie acknowledging her feelings for Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie and Dave Discussing Feelings and Fred

Major_Arcs.title: Confrontation, Emotional Resolution, and New Romance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Carrie's confrontation with Fred and Carlton, her emotional release, and ultimately her romantic resolution with Fred, leading to a marriage proposal and acceptance.

sub_scenes.title: Carlton's Office Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Carrie confronts Fred and Carlton in Carlton's office, accusing Fred of deceit and asserting her independence.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival and Confrontation at Carlton's Office
Reflecting on Fred's Defeat and Carrie's Victory
Chance Encounter and Casual Conversation at the Store
Inquiries About Fred and Confession of Love
Initial Concern and Arrival of Visitors

Major_Arcs.title: New Characters, Gunshot, and Pursuit
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces new characters Chris and Dirk, a gunshot injury to Dirk, and their subsequent escape attempt, followed by a pursuit by the Marshal.

sub_scenes.title: Urgent Request and Gunshot Revelation
sub_scenes.description: Introduction of Chris and Dirk, Dirk's urgent arrival, and the shocking revelation that he has been shot.

narrative_arcs.title: Escalating Confrontation and Claim of Authority
Passage of Time and Acceptance of Reality
Re-emergence of Duty and Dirk's Fate
Moral Dilemma: Mercy Killing vs. Survival
Providing First Aid and Assessing Injury
Parting Ways and Concern for Criminal Escape
Plea to Return and Confession of Love
Rance's Self-Recrimination and Awareness of Burden
Concern for Riding and Inquiry about Dirk
Successful Escape to Mexico and Relief

Major_Arcs.title: Recovery, Love, and Wedding
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc concludes the narrative with Rance's recovery, the deepening romantic relationship between Chris and Rance, and their wedding, bringing a happy resolution to the various conflicts.

sub_scenes.title: Rance's Recovery and Love Confession
sub_scenes.description: Rance recovers and is cared for by Chris and his father, leading to a mutual confession of love between Chris and Rance and a marriage proposal.

narrative_arcs.title: Rance's Reassurance and Readiness for Action
